author: TNN
title: Behind the scenes of ceasefire: Calls from Pakistan, Washington

author: BHARTI JAIN
description: Shortly after a ceasefire pact between India and Pakistan, multiple firing incidents and drone attacks erupted along the international border and LoC, impacting regions from Jammu and Kashmir to Gujarat and Rajasthan. India retaliated, shooting down drones and damaging Pakistani posts, while border residents were urged to seek shelter.
title: Pak violates ceasefire: Blackouts in J&K, Punjab, Rajasthan, Gujarat

author: SACHIN PARASHAR
title: Trump claims credit for ceasefire; agreement after Pak reached out, says govt

author: TNN
title: Chenab swells as India throws open 2 gates of Baglihar dam

title: Govt mocks Pakistan flip-flop on meet of body in charge of nuke arsenal

title: Op Sindoor: Lashkar’s Muridke HQ chief among 140 terrorists killed

author: NAOMI CANTON
title: Op Sindoor: UK channel traces jihadist content to destroyed Muridke site

author: RAJAT PANDIT
title: Amid flare-up hrs after thaw, officials say things will settle with time

author: SUBODH GHILDIYAL
description: A recent Andhra Pradesh health department study reveals a significant surge in alcohol-related liver, neurological, and kidney problems between 2019 and 2024, coinciding with the YSRCP regime. The study highlights a dramatic increase in patients aged 35-44, raising concerns about the quality of liquor available during that period amidst allegations of a "liquor scam."
title: Booze-related health problems spiked in AP from 2019 to 2024: Data

author: SURENDRA SINGH
description: India's surveillance capabilities are poised for a significant boost with ISRO's upcoming launch of the EOS-09 (RISAT-1B) radar imaging satellite on May 18. Equipped with advanced C-band synthetic aperture radar, the satellite will provide high-resolution images regardless of weather conditions. This strengthens border surveillance along sensitive areas with Pakistan and China, while also aiding in anti-terror operations and coastal monitoring.
title: EOS-09 sat set for launch to boost India’s border surveillance powers

author: REBECCA SAMERVEL
description: Gangster Chhota Rajan was acquitted by a special CBI court in a 21-year-old case due to a key witness's uncertainty about the identity of the threat caller. Rajan was accused of ordering a violent shutdown of a construction site in 2004 after a builder allegedly failed to pay the dues.
title: Gangster Chhota Rajan acquitted in 21-year-old case

author: TNN
title: HC dismisses plea to ban non-Hindus from Char Dham shrines

author: TNN
title: Padma Shri awardee, ICAR ex-chief Ayyappan found dead in river

author: SANJAY KHAJURIA
description: Intensified shelling and drone attacks by Pakistani forces across the Jammu region resulted in the loss of four Indian security personnel. Among the casualties were an Army JCO and a rifleman, an IAF sergeant stationed in Udhampur, and a BSF sub-inspector positioned along the international border in the RS Pura sector.
title: Pakistan shelling kills 2 Army men, an IAF Sergeant and a BSF SI in Jammu

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: An alert sentry at Nagrota Military Station thwarted a potential intrusion, sustaining minor injuries during a brief exchange of fire. Simultaneously, a precautionary blackout was enforced in parts of Punjab. India reported ceasefire violations by Pakistan, responding firmly and maintaining a strong vigil along the border and Line of Control after terrorist attack in Pahalgam.
title: Soldier injured in firing at Nagrota Army station in Jammu

author: TNN
description: Amid heightened security concerns, the government has temporarily expanded the CISF's role at Indian civil airports. Effective May 9-18, 2025, CISF will oversee cargo and check-in baggage screening, previously managed by airport operators and airlines. This enhancement aims to reinforce security arrangements, with CISF personnel conducting random checks and overseeing access control to critical facilities.
title: Cargo, check-in baggage now under CISF scanner

author: U SUDHAKAR REDDY AND VIJAY V SINGH
title: I-T commissioner, 4 others held by CBI for Rs 70 lakh bribe

author: TNN
title: Marked improvement in maternal, child health indicators: Government

author: TNN
title: Review call not to pay Rs 5 crore to Mumbai woman: HC to rail minister

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Amid escalating tensions, NSA Ajit Doval and Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi discussed the Pahalgam terror attack. Doval emphasized India's counter-terrorism focus and commitment to a ceasefire, despite Pakistan's provocations. Wang condemned the attack, urging restraint and dialogue, while supporting a comprehensive ceasefire.
title: 'War was not India's choice', NSA Ajit Doval tells China's Wang Yi

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: China vows to stand by Pakistan, calls it ‘iron-clad friend’

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Virender Sehwag criticized Pakistan's ceasefire violation, highlighting the broken truce with a Hindi idiom. Despite agreeing to a full ceasefire mediated by the US, Pakistan targeted areas along the International Border and LoC. This breach followed India's 'Operation Sindoor,' a response to a deadly terror attack in Pahalgam, escalating tensions between the two nations.
title: 'K***e ki dum tedi ki tedi ... ': Sehwag attacks Pakistan

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Bangladesh's interim administration has banned the Awami League, the party of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, under the anti-terrorism law. This ban, pending formal notification, will remain until the International Crimes Tribunal concludes trials against the party and its leaders regarding events before and during their rule, which ended after a July 2024 uprising.
title: Sheikh Hasina’s Awami League banned by Bangladesh’s interim government

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: Mother's Day is a global celebration honoring mothers and their invaluable contributions to families and society. Rooted in ancient traditions and popularized by Anna Jarvis in the United States, it's a day to express love and gratitude.
title: Happy Mother's Day: Wishes, messages, greetings, quotes, gifs, images

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Reports suggest Virat Kohli is considering retiring from Test cricket, prompting reactions from cricketing legends like Brian Lara. Kohli emphasized the demanding nature of Test cricket, highlighting the mental and physical fortitude required to excel. He expressed a desire to guide younger players, ensuring a seamless transition and continued success for Indian cricket.
title: 'I can walk away without any regrets': Virat Kohli

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Just hours after agreeing to a ceasefire mediated by the US, Pakistan launched drones into Indian airspace, triggering sirens and explosions in border states. India's air defense systems neutralized most threats, but the intrusion followed a major retaliatory strike, 'Operation Sindoor,' targeting terror camps in Pakistan after a deadly attack in Pahalgam.
title: Pak drones enter Indian airspace, explosions heard just hours after truce deal

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Sirens, explosions in border districts after Pak breaks deal: What we know so far

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Following a ceasefire agreement between India and Pakistan, brokered by the U.S., former Indian spinner Harbhajan Singh expressed his relief and support. He emphasized India's peace-loving nature while asserting its resolve against aggression and terrorism. The ceasefire agreement was announced by U.S. President Donald Trump on Saturday, who claimed the breakthrough came after American mediation.
title: 'India is a winner on and off the battlefield': Harbhajan slams terrorism

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Brian Lara has voiced strong support for Virat Kohli, dismissing reports of the Indian star's potential Test retirement. Lara believes Kohli's continued presence is vital for Test cricket and predicts he will maintain a high average. With recent retirements in the Indian team, Kohli's experience is seen as crucial during this transitional phase, as the cricket world awaits his decision.
title: 'Test cricket needs Virat Kohli': Brian Lara urges Indian star not to retire

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: 'What happened to ceasefire?' J&K CM after explosions heard across Srinagar

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following a terror attack and subsequent military actions, India and Pakistan have agreed to an immediate ceasefire. The United States mediated the agreement after intense diplomatic engagement with both nations' leaders. Both countries have agreed to start talks on a broad set of issues at a neutral site.
title: What role did US play in India, Pak ceasefire deal?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: 'Any future act of terror will ...': India's big stand against Pak

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: Following a ceasefire agreement between India and Pakistan, the BCCI is poised to resume the IPL 2025 by Thursday or Friday. Matches will be held across India, excluding Dharamsala, after the league's suspension due to cross-border tensions. Overseas players will return to rejoin their teams, with the Delhi Capitals-Punjab Kings fixture potentially restarting.
title: IPL 2025 set to resume next week, franchises touch base with overseas players

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India and Pakistan have agreed to a ceasefire across land, air, and sea. The decision followed a conversation between the Directors General of Military Operations from both nations. A follow-up meeting is scheduled for May 12. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar reaffirmed India’s stance against terrorism. Various political leaders welcomed the ceasefire.
title: 'Must stay focused': How leaders reacted to India, Pak ceasefire

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following escalating tensions sparked by a terror attack in Pahalgam, India and Pakistan have agreed to a ceasefire, halting all military actions across land, air, and sea, effective from 5 pm today. The decision, reached after a call initiated by Pakistan's DGMO, includes keeping the Indus Water Treaty in abeyance and maintaining retaliatory measures announced on April 23.
title: No conditions for ceasefire; Indus Water Treaty to remain suspended

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Ixigo has suspended all travel bookings to Turkey, China, and Azerbaijan, citing their perceived anti-India stance amidst ongoing tensions with Pakistan. This decision follows similar actions by Cox & Kings, who paused new travel offerings to Azerbaijan, Uzbekistan, and Turkey. EaseMyTrip has also issued a travel advisory, urging caution for Indian travelers visiting Turkey and Azerbaijan due to geopolitical concerns.
title: Op Sindoor: Ixigo joins the 'boycott' Turkey, China, Azerbaijan

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India and Pakistan have agreed to halt all military actions across land, air, and sea, effective from 17:00 hours IST on Saturday. This understanding was reached during a call between the Directors General of Military Operations of both countries. The decision follows heightened tensions, including India's 'Operation Sindoor' in response to a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir.
title: After Pak dials India, both sides agree to stop firing; top military officials to talk on May 12

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: 'Armed forces remain operationally ready': India after ceasefire announcement

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar announced that India and Pakistan have reached an understanding to halt firing and military actions, reaffirming India's firm stance against terrorism. This agreement followed a call initiated by Pakistan's DGMO, with both sides agreeing to cease military activity on land, air, and sea.
title: 'Firm stance on terrorism will continue': EAM after India, Pak agree to stop military ops

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: YouTuber Nitish Rajput's YouTube channel has been blocked in Pakistan reportedly following a video he posted about Balochistan. Rajput shared notices from YouTube indicating the ban resulted from a legal complaint filed by the Pakistani government. This action follows heightened tensions between India and Pakistan.
title: Indian YouTuber banned in Pakistan after posting video on Balochistan

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The ministry of external affairs revealed Pakistan's misinformation campaign. Pakistan falsely claimed damage to Indian military assets, including the S-400 and BrahMos missiles. They also alleged damage to airfields and ammunition depots. India clarified its secular values, denying allegations of damaging mosques. This followed India's strikes on terror camps and an agreement to halt military action.
title: 'No damage to S-400, BrahMoS missile base': MEA exposes Pak's misinfo campaign

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Former cricketer Ambati Rayudu has urged Virat Kohli to reconsider his reported Test retirement, emphasizing the team's need for his continued presence. Kohli, a pivotal figure in India's Test dominance with over 9,000 runs, faces widespread appeals from fans and former players to extend his red-ball legacy.
title: 'Virat Kohli, please don't retire; Team India needs you'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Following the suspension of PSL 2025 due to escalating India-Pakistan tensions, Bangladesh's Rishad Hossain recounted the fear among foreign cricketers. Players like Daryl Mitchell vowed never to return to Pakistan after being safely evacuated to Dubai. Tom Curran was emotionally distraught, highlighting the severity of the situation, with a missile strike narrowly missing their departing flight.
title: 'Would never go to Pak again': NZ cricketer after PSL evacuation to Dubai

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Tensions between India and Pakistan de-escalated as US President Trump announced a "full and immediate ceasefire" brokered by the United States. This follows heightened conflict, including India's response to drone attacks from Pakistan and 'Operation Sindoor,' a counterterror action targeting terror camps.
title: 'Common sense prevailed': Trump on India-Pak ceasefire on Truth Social

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: With Rohit Sharma's retirement and Virat Kohli's expected departure, India faces a Test squad rebuild for the next World Test Championship cycle. KL Rahul is crucial in the middle order, while youngsters like Sai Sudharsan are making a strong case for selection.
title: Life after Virat, Rohit: Stern test awaits selectors, Gambhir and the BCCI

author: VISHWA MOHAN
title: Monsoon is likely to hit Kerala on May 27, says IMD

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has debunked viral videos falsely claiming Pakistan attacked Indian Air Force bases in Udhampur and Nagrota. These videos, circulated on social media, used old footage unrelated to current tensions.
title: Nagrota, Udhampur air bases attacked? PIB fact checks

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Pak using Islam as a facade, targeting civilians to fuel division in India: Owaisi

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Ready for 'full, unconditional' 30-day ceasefire with Russia: Ukraine

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: In a shocking turn of events at the Women’s T20 World Cup Asia Qualifier, the UAE defeated Qatar by 163 runs after all ten of their batters bizarrely retired out. Openers Esha Oza and Theertha Satish dominated with a 192-run partnership before the unusual strategy was implemented, reportedly due to a looming rain threat. Qatar then collapsed for just 29 runs.
title: Why all 10 UAE batters retired out at the same time against Qatar

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Prime Minister Modi convened a high-level security meeting with top officials, including the armed forces chiefs and Defence Minister, amidst escalating tensions with Pakistan. The meeting addressed Pakistan's troop movements to forward areas and attempts to infiltrate Indian air bases, resulting in damage and casualties.
title: PM Modi chairs high-level meeting with top security officials

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India-Pakistan tensions: Following the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor, India's stock market has shown resilience with minimal decline, contrasting sharply with Pakistan's KSE-100's significant drop. This divergence highlights India's stronger economic fundamentals, larger market capitalization, and robust domestic investor base.
title: Reality check: India stock market is 245 times Pak stock market!

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: High-stakes tariff negotiations have commenced in Geneva between US and Chinese officials, aiming to de-escalate the escalating trade war. These talks mark the first direct engagement since the US increased tariffs on China, prompting retaliatory measures.
title: US, China begin high-stakes tariff talks in Geneva to ease trade war tensions

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: PIB Fact Check has alerted social media users about a surge in fake videos designed to spread Pakistani propaganda and manipulate perceptions of the Indian armed forces and the current India-Pakistan situation. They advise caution, urging people not to share unverified content and debunked a false claim about turning off GPS, clarifying that the government issued no such advisory.
title: Your Instagram, Facebook feeds are under 'Pakistani attack', warns gov

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Melinda French Gates supports the Gates Foundation's plan to spend its $200 billion endowment by 2045 on global health, emphasizing the original intent to give back to society. The foundation will double its spending to combat diseases and poverty. French Gates believes billionaires have a moral obligation to contribute, hoping for lasting positive impact even after the foundation closes.
title: Melinda French Gates opens up on Bill Gates plan to give away his wealth

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Abu Jundal, Yusuf Azhar & more: 5 key Pakistani terrorists killed in Operation Sindoor

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India retaliated strongly after Pakistan launched drone and missile attacks across multiple locations, including civilian areas. Indian armed forces swiftly neutralized hostile drones targeting key sites like Amritsar and Pathankot. Retaliatory operations, named Operation Sindoor, destroyed terror launch pads in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.
title: From Amritsar to Pathankot: Visuals show Army taking down Pak drones, missiles

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Delhi experienced heavy rainfall on Saturday, offering respite from rising temperatures, as predicted by the IMD. The city's maximum temperature on Friday was 36.7 degrees Celsius, while the minimum was 25.7 degrees Celsius. Air quality remained in the "moderate" category with an AQI of 151, according to the CPCB, indicating acceptable air quality with potential minor discomfort for sensitive groups.
title: Heavy rain lashes parts of Delhi

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Judea Pearl, father of Daniel Pearl, celebrated the reported death of Abdul Rauf Asghar. Asghar was linked to his son's murder. Pearl sang Israel's national anthem. He questioned Pakistan's actions regarding terrorists. Pearl seeks justice for his son's kidnapping and murder in 2002. He highlighted the unpunished roles of Khalid Sheikh Mohammed and Omar Sheikh.
title: Op Sindoor: Journalist Pearl's father sings Israel anthem on learning killers elimiated

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif stated that madrasa students would serve as the country's second line of defence in case of war with India. This statement follows Asif's previous controversial claims, including assertions about downing Indian jets based on social media reports.
title: Pak to deploy students in case of war with India? What Khawaja Asif said

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Following Operation Sindoor, PIB FactCheck has debunked several fake social media posts spreading misinformation. Claims of crashed IAF jets, ATM closures, airport shutdowns, and electricity grid failures due to cyberattacks are all false.
title: Entry to airports banned, ATMs closed & more such news: Govt says ‘fake news'

author: JYOTIRMOY HALDER
description: Maheshwari Chauhan narrowly missed an Olympic medal. The shooter is using the loss as motivation. She faced another setback at the World Cup. Maheshwari is focused on future competitions. She aims to consistently reach finals and secure podium finishes. Her goals include the Asian Games and the World Championship. She is also aiming for the 2028 Olympics.
title: Indian farm girl who picked up gun at 13, now recovering Oly heartbreak

author: NIRMALYA DUTTA
description: As Krishna told the original peacenik of the Mahabharata—the man who put the “him” in Ahimsa—there comes a time when even the most reluctant warrior must pick up his bow.
title: Sindoor, Shakti and Symbolism: How Pahalgam payback united almost every Indian

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Central banks globally, including India, are increasing gold reserves to diversify holdings and hedge against economic uncertainties. From 2009 to 2024, collective gold holdings grew significantly, with Russia, Egypt, and Argentina leading in expanding gold's proportion within their foreign exchange reserves.
title: Big jump! Not just RBI, central banks around the world buying gold

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The government addressed claims of damaged Indian air bases during Operation Sindoor. Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri, Col Sofiya Qureshi, and Wing Commander Vyomika Singh presented evidence. Col Qureshi stated Pakistan attempted air infiltration at multiple locations. She confirmed damage to equipment at air force bases in Udhampur, Bhuj, Pathankot, and Bathinda. Wing Commander Singh noted troop movements suggesting potential escalation.
title: Govt shows time-stamped pictures to dismiss Pakistan's claims about air force stations

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: In response to Pakistan's drone attacks in Jammu & Kashmir and Punjab, the Indian Army launched Operation Sindoor, destroying terrorist launch pads near the Line of Control. The operation, executed on May 8-9, targeted hubs used for planning attacks on Indian civilians and security forces. Earlier, Indian air defense units intercepted and destroyed multiple armed drones over Amritsar.
title: Operation Sindoor: Army releases video of troops in action along LoC

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India launched retaliatory precision strikes on military targets within Pakistan following Islamabad's latest aggression, including missile attacks on Indian air bases and infiltration attempts. India targeted technical installations, command centers, and radar sites while ensuring minimal collateral damage.
title: Which Pakistan military targets were hit by India in retaliatory strikes

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India has firmly refuted Pakistan's claims of widespread destruction and escalation following Operation Sindoor, dismissing them as fabricated lies intended to mislead the international community. Indian officials clarified that the strikes were a calibrated response to Pakistani drone attacks, targeting only identified military locations.
title: 'Attempted malicious misinformation campaign': Govt calls out Pakistan’s propaganda

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: During the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, Virat Kohli hinted at retiring from Test cricket, a notion initially dismissed. Despite a desire to lead again, the BCCI, focused on the future, didn't entertain it, earmarking Shubman Gill for captaincy. Kohli's decision, potentially influenced by form or captaincy discussions, means India will likely miss his presence at No.4 in Tests.
title: 'I am done... ': Virat Kohli to India teammates during Border-Gavaskar Trophy

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Tensions escalate as India accuses Pakistan of relentless attacks on its western border, employing drones, missiles, and fighter jets, targeting military sites and even civilian infrastructure. India claims to have retaliated with precision strikes on identified military targets, dismissing Pakistan's misinformation campaign. The Border Security Force reports destroying a terrorist launch pad in Sialkot after unprovoked firing.
title: 'Pak used drones, long-range weapons, jets to attack India's military sites'

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India reports responding firmly to Pakistan's escalating provocations, including armed drone incursions. Foreign Secretary Misri addressed the nation, highlighting the interception of Pakistani UAVs over Amritsar. The BSF retaliated by destroying a Pakistani post and a terrorist launch pad used for drone attacks. Civilian areas in Punjab and Jammu & Kashmir experienced attacks and shelling, causing injuries and panic.
title: 'Pakistan army moving its troops in forward areas': Key takeaways from govt briefing

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following unprovoked firing, Indian forces destroyed a terrorist launchpad in Pakistan's Sialkot district used for infiltration. Retaliation followed Pakistani attacks on 26 locations, including Jammu and Pathankot, with drone sightings prompting alerts. The escalation resulted in casualties and heightened security measures in border regions, as India responds to sustained provocations with precision strikes.
title: Watch: BSF completely destroys terrorist launch pad at Looni in Pakistan's Sialkot

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India shines at the Archery World Cup Stage 2 in Shanghai. The team clinched gold in the compound men's team event. Indian women secured silver in their team event. Abhishek Verma and Madhura Dhamangaonkar won bronze in the mixed team competition. These wins highlight India's growing strength in compound archery.
title: Gold for India! Men's compound team hits bullseye at Archery World Cup

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Pakistan's military aggression escalated with drone strikes near western borders, prompting India's 'Operation Sindoor.' Armed drones targeting Amritsar were destroyed, as confirmed by the Indian Army. Explosions and sirens rattled Jammu following suspected drone incursions. Cross-border artillery exchanges intensified along the LoC, impacting Rajouri and Poonch.
title: Pak drones flying over Khasa Cantt in Amritsar destroyed; Army releases video

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: Researchers at Mass General Brigham have created FaceAge, an AI tool that estimates biological age from facial features. A study of over 6,000 cancer patients revealed that those with an older FaceAge had poorer survival rates. Integrating FaceAge with clinical assessments improved the accuracy of predicting survival outcomes, potentially revolutionizing patient care through tailored treatment plans.
title: AI can predict cancer survival by analysing an individual's selfie

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Amid escalating tensions, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio has urged Pakistan's army chief Asim Munir to de-escalate hostilities with India, offering US assistance for constructive talks. This follows retaliatory strikes by Indian forces on Pakistani air bases and terror launch pads after cross-border provocations, including drone attacks targeting key Indian infrastructure.
title: 'Find ways to de-escalate': US secy of state speaks with Pak army chief Asim Munir

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Tensions escalate as Pakistan reports India launched missiles at its air bases, triggering retaliatory strikes. Pakistan claims interception of most missiles, targeting Indian facilities in response. The conflict follows a deadly attack in Kashmir, blamed on Pakistan by India. Amidst rising tensions, both sides accuse each other of cross-border attacks, including drone incursions and airstrikes, further destabilizing the region.
title: Nur Khan, Murid and Rafiqui: Why these 3 Pakistan air bases were targeted by India

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Sourav Ganguly commented on the BCCI's decision to suspend IPL 2025 for a week due to escalating India-Pakistan tensions. He expressed hope for a swift resumption, emphasising the importance of completing the tournament. The Punjab Kings-Delhi Capitals match in Dharamshala was halted abruptly due to security concerns, with players and staff transported to Delhi via special train.
title: 'Pakistan will not be able to ... ': Ganguly gives massive verdict

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Omar Abdullah criticized the international community and IMF for approving a $1 billion loan to Pakistan amidst heightened tensions and cross-border conflict. He suggested the funds could indirectly support Pakistan's military actions. The IMF approved the disbursement despite India's opposition and concerns that the funds might be misused for terrorism, leading India to abstain from the vote.
title: 'Reimburses for all ordnance': Omar Abdullah hits out at IMF for $1bn loan to Pakistan

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: A senior government officer was killed in Pakistani shelling in Rajouri district of Jammu and Kashmir early Saturday. Additional Deputy Commissioner Rajouri, Raj Kumar Thapa, succumbed to injuries after his residence was struck by an artillery shell. Two of his staff members were also critically injured.
title: Senior J&K official killed, 2 injured in Pakistan shelling in Rajouri

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Following security concerns amidst escalating tensions between India and Pakistan, the Indian Premier League was suspended on Friday by a week. While the BCCI hopes to complete the tournament in India, England has emerged as a potential alternative host. The ECB is open to discussions, with suggestions including finishing the IPL before India's Test series or in September.
title: England open to hosting remainder of IPL 2025 after week's suspension

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: G7 nations have condemned the terrorist attack in Pahalgam and urged India and Pakistan to exercise maximum restraint amid rising military tensions. They called for immediate de-escalation and encouraged direct dialogue for a peaceful resolution, expressing deep concern for civilian safety.
title: G7 nations urge India, Pakistan to exercise maximum restraint

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rohit Sharma's Test retirement has ignited debate, with Sanjay Manjrekar citing his recent slump and fitness concerns. Manjrekar highlighted Sharma's poor performance, averaging 10.9 in his last nine matches. Sharma, 38, announced his exit via Instagram, amidst scrutiny and leadership change speculations. Despite a strong Test career with 4,301 runs, his recent form dipped.
title: Manjrekar rips into Rohit Sharma: 'His current fitness levels ... '

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following Pakistani drone attacks targeting Indian military and civilian sites, India retaliated by destroying key Pakistani posts and terrorist launch pads near Jammu. Pakistan claims its airbases were targeted, vowing retaliation and temporarily closing its airspace. India remains on high alert, activating missile systems and continuing counter-drone operations along the LoC after the Pahalgam terror attack and 'Operation Sindoor'.
title: Watch: Army destroys Pak posts, terror launch pads used for drone attacks in Jammu

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Following escalating tensions between India and Pakistan after the Pahalgam attack, Indian travel companies like EaseMyTrip and Cox & Kings are taking a stand against Turkey and Azerbaijan due to their pro-Pakistan stance. EaseMyTrip advises caution when visiting these nations, while Cox & Kings has paused new travel offerings, urging Indian travelers to consider the geopolitical environment.
title: EaseMyTrip, Cox & Kings suspend all travel to Azerbaijan & Turkey, 'join' 'boycott' call

author: RAJ SHEKHAR JHA
title: TTP & Baloch fighters also draw Pakistan army blood, kill 22

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: The highly anticipated 'Raid 2,' starring Ajay Devgn and Riteish Deshmukh, has achieved blockbuster status. The film opened strongly on May 1, 2025, earning over Rs. 19 crore. After a successful nine-day run, 'Raid 2' has now crossed the coveted Rs. 100 crore mark, solidifying its box office success with a total of ₹ 100.75 Cr.
title: Ajay Devgn and Riteish Deshmukh starrer ‘Raid 2’ joins Rs 100 crore club

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Delhi Airport has resumed normal operations but advises passengers to expect potential delays due to heightened security measures amid India-Pakistan tensions. Thirty-two airports across Northern and Western India faced temporary closures for civil flight operations. Drones were spotted at twenty-six locations near the International Border and Line of Control, raising security concerns.
title: India-Pakistan tensions: Delhi airport issues travel advisory

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: A significant measles outbreak grips America. The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention confirms over 1,000 cases across 31 states. Children are particularly affected. Unvaccinated individuals account for a large percentage of infections. Hospitalization is required in some cases. The CDC highlights symptoms like fever, cough, and a distinctive rash. Vaccination remains the most effective preventive measure.
title: Measles cases in US cross 1,000: Early symptoms, prevention tips to know

author: DISNEY TOM
description: A Jaipur court dismissed a complaint against Rahul Gandhi regarding alleged casteist remarks against PM Modi. The court stated it lacked jurisdiction to determine caste or gotra. The complaint stemmed from Gandhi's claim during a Bharat Jodo Nyay Yatra that Modi wasn't OBC by birth, inciting unrest, leading to the dismissal.
title: Court junks complaint against Rahul for 'PM not OBC by birth' remark

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Explosions heard at several places in Pakistan - What we know

author: TNN
description: India has strongly condemned Pakistan for endangering civilian air traffic by using it as a shield during drone and missile attacks across the international border. Wing Commander Vyomika Singh highlighted that Pakistan did not close its airspace despite launching an attack on May 7, risking the safety of commercial flights.
title: 'Pakistan using civilian air traffic as shield, putting lives at risk': FS Misri

author: NASEER GANAI AND SANJAY KHAJURIA
description: Pakistani shelling across the Line of Control resulted in casualties. An Army jawan, M Murali Naik, lost his life. A woman in Uri and a man in Poonch also died. Six other civilians sustained injuries due to the intense firing. Indian troops retaliated effectively. A family in Uri was injured while fleeing, resulting in the death of Nargis Bano.
title: Soldier from Andhra Pradesh, 2 civilians killed in Pakistan firing at LoC

author: RAJAT PANDIT
title: Two airports targeted In 24 hours: First Jammu, then Srinagar
